alert.note: Alert for Brantley; Coastal Camden; Inland Camden; Inland Glynn; Northeastern Charlton; Western Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 4:07PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Nassau, western Camden, southwestern Glynn, southeastern Brantley and northeastern Charlton Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 407 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from near Hickox to 7 miles north of Kings Ferry to near Folkston. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts up to 50 mph, minor flooding due to heavy rainfall, and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Folkston, Woodbine, Homeland, Waverly, Waynesville, Race Pond, Atkinson, Winokur, Tarboro and Colesburg. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northeastern Florida...and southeastern Georgia.

area.areaDesc: Brantley; Coastal Camden; Inland Camden; Inland Glynn; Northeastern Charlton; Western Charlton
